Eastern State is often called “the world’s first penitentiary,” but the Walnut Street Jail, built in 1790 in Philadelphia, predates it. Eastern State, however, became the model and iconic repre­sen­ta­tion of the Pennsylvania system of imprisonment, structured around isolation, solitude, and sensory deprivation
